law.text:
// EFFECTIVE UNTIL JUNE 30, 2015 PER CHAPTERS 624 AND 625 OF 2008 //
The Commission, in collaboration with community health resources and local health departments, shall develop a specialty care network for individuals:
With family income that does not exceed 200% of the federal poverty level; and
Who are referred through a community health resource.
The specialty care network shall:
Consist of health care practitioners who agree to provide care to individuals referred through a community health resource for a discounted fee established by the Commission; and
Include health care practitioners who historically have served the uninsured.
Individuals receiving health care through the specialty care network shall pay for specialty care according to a sliding fee scale developed by the Commission.
In addition to patient fees, office-based specialty care visits, diagnostic testing, and laboratory tests shall be subsidized by funds provided from:
General funds; and
Money collected from a nonprofit health maintenance organization in accordance with § 6-121(b)(3) of the Insurance Article.
Subject to available funding, the Commission shall provide subsidies to community health resources for office-based specialty care visits, diagnostic testing, and laboratory tests.
